src:
Setelah Lem Aibon, Muncul Anggaran Janggal Penataan Kampung Kumuh
04 Nov 2019, 03:53 by Antara, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Polemik soal anggaran janggal dalam rancangan APBD DKI 2020 tak selesai dengan anggaran lem aibon dan ballpoint. Kini DPRD DKI Jakarta mempertanyakan anggaran konsultan penataan Rukun Warga (RW) kumuh.
Anggota Komisi D DPRD DKI Jakarta, Yuke Yurike, menyatakan dalam rancangan APBD 2020, Pemprov DKI Jakarta mengusulkan anggaran konsultan sebesar Rp 556 juta per RW. Anggaran dengan nama kegiatan Community Action Plan (CAP) itu dinilai terlalu besar jika hanya untuk jasa konsultan per RW.
"Satu RW itu Rp556 juta? Kalau 200 RW itu butuh berapa coba? Tidak bisa kerja sama dengan kampus atau sebagainya?," ujar Yuke seperti dilansir laman Antara.
Politikus Partai Demokrasi Indonesia Perjuangan tersebut menjabarkan, anggaran sebesar itu terbagi dua, yaitu biaya langsung untuk personel Rp 475,8 juta dan biaya langsung non personel Rp29,7 juta.
Biaya langsung personel itu terdiri atas tenaga ahli, fasilitator, surveyor dan sebagainya. Sedangkan biaya langsung tidak personel, yaitu laporan teknis detail engineering design (DED), pelaksanaan sosialisasi dan focus group discusion (FGD).
Menurut Yuke, Komisi D DPRD DKI Jakarta terkejut melihat dan mendengarkan usulan Dinas Perumahan DKI Jakarta tersebut. Meskipun rancangan APBD DKI tersebut masih bersifat sementara, Menurut Yuke, anggaran CAP yang fungsinya hanya sebagai konsultan dalam penataan kampung kumuh itu terlalu mahal.
Yuke mengatakan dirinya tidak melihat adanya penataan kampung kumuh selama dua tahun Anies Baswedan menjabat sebagai Gubernur DKI Jakarta. Kendati demikian, dia menyatakan setuju dengan penataan kampung kumuh, namun terkait anggaran harus ada evaluasi.
"Kami akan meminta penjelasan soal ini secara detil dalam pembahasan teknis nanti. Tapi kami harus menegaskan bahwa kami meminta agar Dinas Perumahan segera mewujudkan penataan kampung kumuh," katanya.
Ketua Kordinator Komisi D yang juga Wakil Ketua Badan Anggaran (Banggar) DPRD DKI Jakarta, Muhammad Taufik mengatakan akan meminta penjelasan Dinas Perumahan terkait penataan kampung kumuh, khususnya anggaran CAP yang hanya berfungsi sebagai konsultan.
"Konsultan itu rumus biayanya dua persen dari total pelaksanaan kegiatan. Kalau hampir Rp600 juta itu, berapa usulan pembangunannya?," tuturnya.
Pemprov DKI Jakarta memang mencanangkan menata 200 RW kumuh selama lima tahun dari 2017 hingga 2022. Beberapa diantaranya adalah penataan Kampung Akuarium dan Bukit Duri. Kedua kampung ini sejak awal sudah dicanangkan untuk ditata namun hingga saat ini belum juga terealisasi.
Menurut data Urban Poor Consorsium, Pemprov DKI Jakarta bahkan suah melakukan program CAP di 21 kampung kumuh. Namun hanya satu kelurahan yang berhasil dieksekusi penataannya.
"Soal penataan kampung waktu itu sudah dilakukan comunication action plan. Tapi ternyata hasilnya belum ada yang bisa dilaksanakan," kata Koordinator Advokasi UPC, Gugun Muhammad, beberapa waktu lalu. "Hanya ada satu kelurahan yang bisa dieksekusi. Itu di Kelurahan Ancol."
Gugun sempat menyatakan bahwa penataan kampung kumuh selama ini terhambat soal aturan. Pemprov DKI Jakarta pun dinilai tak berhasil mencari solusi dari masalah ini dan cenderung menyerah.
text:
After Aibon Glue, An Odd Village Arrangement Budget appeared
Nov 04 2019, 03:53 by Antara, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The polemic about the odd budget in the DKI 2020 APBD draft was not finished with the aibon glue and ballpoint budget. Now the DKI Jakarta Regional House of Representatives (DPRD) is questioning the budget of the slum residents' (RW) structuring consultant.
DKI Jakarta DPRD Commission D member Yuke Yurike said in the 2020 APBD draft, the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government proposed a consultant budget of Rp. 556 million per RW. The budget with the name of the Community Action Plan (CAP) activity is considered to be too big if it is only for consultant services per RW.
"One RW is Rp. 556 million? How many 200 RWs do you need? Try not to cooperate with the campus or the like?" Yuke said as reported by Antara page.
The politician from the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle explained that such a large budget was divided into two, namely direct costs for personnel of Rp. 475.8 million and direct costs for non-personnel Rp. 29.7 million.
The direct costs of the personnel consist of experts, facilitators, surveyors and so on. While the direct costs are not personnel, namely the detailed engineering design (DED) technical report, the implementation of the socialization and focus group discussion (FGD).
According to Yuke, Commission D of DKI Jakarta DPRD was surprised to see and listen to the DKI Jakarta Housing Agency's proposal. Although the DKI APBD draft is still temporary, According to Yuke, the CAP budget, whose function is only as a consultant in the arrangement of slums, is too expensive.
Yuke said he had not seen any slum structuring for two years Anies Baswedan served as the Governor of DKI Jakarta. Nevertheless, he said he agreed with the arrangement of slums, but related to the budget there must be an evaluation.
"We will ask for an explanation of this problem in detail in the technical discussion later. But we must emphasize that we ask that the Housing Agency immediately realize the arrangement of the slums," he said.
The Head of Commission D Coordinator who is also the Deputy Chairperson of the DKI Jakarta DPRD Budget Agency (Banggar), Muhammad Taufik, said that he would ask for an explanation from the Housing Office regarding the arrangement of slums, especially the CAP budget which only functions as a consultant.
"The consultant said that the formula will cost two percent of the total implementation of the activity. If it is almost Rp. 600 million, how much is the proposed development?"
The DKI Jakarta Provincial Government has indeed planned 200 slum RWs for five years from 2017 to 2022. Some of them are structuring the Kampung Aquarium and Bukit Duri. These two villages have since been planned to be arranged but until now they have not been realized.
According to the Urban Poor Consortium data, the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government has even done a CAP program in 21 slum villages. But only one kelurahan has been managed successfully.
"The matter of structuring the village at that time had already been carried out a communication action plan. But apparently the results have not been able to be implemented," said UPC Advocacy Coordinator, Gugun Muhammad, some time ago. "There is only one kelurahan that can be executed. That is in Ancol Kelurahan."
Gugun had stated that the arrangement of slums had been hampered by the rules. The DKI Jakarta Provincial Government was considered unsuccessful in finding solutions to this problem and tended to give up.
